attributes.action: New Years honours for the correct people, not the celebrities.
attributes.additional_details: Each year elitist celebrities are given honours with a significant amount of them being awarded to people that have no relevance to the general population. Honours are awarded to dancers or clothes designers that do not impact on the life of 99.9% of the population. This leads to an “us and them” mentality in our society. Give honours to those that have sacrificed themselves to and for the public.
attributes.background: It should be written into law that each year at least 10 people from each of the emergency services, teachers and the NHS with over 20 years service should be honoured for their service to the people of the country.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about honours or appointments. 

Members of the public can nominate people for honours directly. You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour here:

https://www.gov.uk/honours
